items.q: Henry Salt's 1892 book on animal rights ____. a. was read by all the schoolchildren in Britain b. began the animal rights movement c. said animals had less rights than humans d. was in favor of humans eating meat
The chimpanzee Washoe learned ____. a. American Sign Language b. to count to 1,000 c. to build bridges with blocks d. to verbalize 100 words in English
The status of a "sentient being" means having ____. a. consciousness and emotions b. emotions just related to family c. the ability to meditate d. the ability to use language
The first European nation to include animal rights in their constitution was ____. a. England b. France c. Germany d. Italy
Animal rights activists point out that certain animals have a well-developed consciousness . The word consciousness means ____. a. purpose b. memory c. awareness d. education
When people deliberately harm animals, they do it ____. a. accidentally b. intentionally c. legally d. quietly
What's your opinion on the ____ of animal rights? a. issue b. memory c. production d. answer
Germany has passed a law that adds tighter restrictions on using animals for cosmetic and drug testing. Another word for restrictions is ____. a. issues b. rules c. pursuits d. respect

The purpose of cloning chickens is to ____. a. treat chickens humanely b. to gain more experience with cloning c. to obtain increased yield of chicken meat and eggs d. to help chickens reproduce more successfully
A "chimera" contains ____. a. cells from a donor and a recipient b. cells from only the donor c. cells from only the recipient d. only differentiated cells

Animal welfare groups are opposed to cloning chickens because ____. a. it can cause disease and injury to the chickens b. the eggs will be unsafe to eat c. its too expensive d. farms will produce more than they can sell
The product that contaminated corn based products was ____. a. a type of animal feed b. a fast-growing weed c. a genetically modified fruit d. a. meat product

The corn-based crops got contaminated from ____. a. pollen drift and feed residue b. farmers transporting boxes of corn c. factory workers placing it in canned goods d. farmers spreading it over wheat crops

At this time, the FDA ____. a. requires full labeling of domestic genetically modified foods b. opposes voluntary labeling for domestic genetically modified foods c. does not require any labeling of genetically modified exports d. has no position on labeling of domestic genetically modified foods

Opponents of genetically modified foods worry about ____. a. an increase in lawsuits against the government b. increased testing of DNA transfer from one organism to another c. an increased cost to consumers d. the unpredictability of results and potential health hazards

Genetically modified foods are created by ____. a. transferring RNA from organism to organism b. inserting a gene from one organism into the DNA of another c. inserting a newly developed virus into an existing crop d. cloning an agricultural crop and duplicating it
The Royal Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals was founded in ____. a. 1776 b. 1824 c. 1892 d. the 1970s
Which of the following creatures do chimpanzee researchers not include on their list of animals that are in some ways similar to humans? a. birds b. gorillas c. whales d. dolphins
The company’s profits increased because they _____ their sales. a. teamed up b. abused c. endowed d. scaled up
The young employee _____ having her own company. a. envisaged b. rated c. adopted d. restricted
Foreign students sometimes _____ cultural characteristics of the host country. a. put off b. adopt c. prospect d. supply
This high technology _____ is rapidly changing the world. a. resistance b. victim c. era d. donor
The FDA is not sure that meat and eggs from cloned chickens is safe for humans to eat.
When writing body paragraphs for an argument essay, write the strongest argument first.
The thesis statement for an argument essay is the same as in other types of essays.
The conclusion in an argument essay ends with alternatives or a demand for action.
Britain passed laws preventing animal abuse before it passed laws about protecting children.
Scientists at Wayne State University found that human genes and ape genes had very little in common.
An argument essay mentions both sides of an argument.
The refutation in an argument essay usually follows the introduction.
A strong argument essay can be developed without facts and statistics.
An argument essay contains a refutation of the opposing side.
If your team prevails , it wins the game.
Animal rights activists want to treat animals humanely.
People are usually proud when they abuse an animal.
If you are in pursuit of someone, you are chasing him or her.
Mount Everest is a massive mountain.
Sheep are more vulnerable to attack than lions.
When the government modifies a law, the law stays the same.
Another word for prospect is “possibility.”
If you team up with someone, you disagree with their viewpoint.
When a machine is used in the cloning process, about 75% of the clones die.
In the current cloning process, the clone is 100% identical to the original.
The National Institute of Science and Technology supports cloning research.
Origen provides farmers with genetically modified chickens as well as clones.
Embrex has machines that can inject vaccines into 50,000 eggs an hour.
Is this essay in favor or opposed to the use of genetically modified food?
What reasons does the writer give for his opinion?
Write a conclusion for this argument essay. End with an alternative or demand for action.
Write an argument essay in favor or opposed to banning the sale of cigarettes because of the health hazards it poses to the individuals who smoke and the people who are in contact with the smoke.
